ili.lithne

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • ili.lithne.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LithneListener, MessageListener, XBeeListener

    public class Message
extends Object
implements LithneListener, XBeeListener, MessageListener

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addArgument(boolean argument)
      Add a boolean as an argument.
      boolean addArgument(float argument)
      Adds the specific argument to the list of arguments
      boolean addArgument(int argument)
      Adds the argument to the message at the end of the current message array.
      boolean addArguments(int[] arguments)
      Adds multiple arguments to the message at the end of the array.
      void addArguments(String arguments)
      Adds a string of arguments to the message in the format "xx, xx, xx"
      boolean addByte(int argument)
      Adds a byte to the end of the payload.
      void appendIfDifferent(int argNumber)
      This function adds the argument number that should be considered when appending messages to each other.
      boolean argumentsFull()
      Indicates whether the maximum number of arguments has been reached.
      int attempts()
      Same as getRetries()
      void clear()
      Clears the internally stored data, to ready the message for new data
      void clearAppendArguments()
      Clears the existing arguments that should be considered for appending
      void clearArguments()
      Clears all arguments in the message, leaves the scope and function untouched
      void clearFrom()
      Clears the from-fields (sender's fields) of this message
      void clearFunction()
      This function resets the currently set function to the standard (Message.ERROR_MESSAGE = 255)
      void clearPayload()
      This function clears the entire payload and reinitializes the standard scope and function
      void clearScope()
      Removes the scope of the message
      void clearTo()
      Clears the to-fields (destination's fields) of this message
      void clearTransmissionStatus()
      Clears all meta level information regarding the transmission of the message
      void delivered(boolean deliveryState)
      Indicates the delivery status of the message (true/false) and the milliseconds the message was delivered.
      void delivered(Lithne lithne, boolean deliveryState, int millis)
      Indicates the delivery status of the message (true/false) and the milliseconds the message was delivered.
      int deliveredAt()
      Returns when the message was delivered (in millis(); Processing)
      int deliveredAt(int time)
      Sets the time at which the message was delivered and returns this value
      boolean deliverySuccess()
      Returns whether the message delivery was successful or not
      boolean equalsDestination(Message msg)
      This function checks whether the specified message and this message have an equal destination address.
      XBeeAddress16 fromXBeeAddress16()
      Returns the current from-field network address (XBeeAddress16).
      XBeeAddress16 fromXBeeAddress16(XBeeAddress16 xbeeAddress16)
      Updates the from-field network address (XBeeAddress16) to the specified value.
      XBeeAddress64 fromXBeeAddress64()
      Returns the 64-bit address of the sender of the message and returns an unknown address if the 64-bit address is not entered
      XBeeAddress64 fromXBeeAddress64(XBeeAddress64 xbeeAddress64)
      Sets the from-field to the specified hardware address (XBeeAddress64).
      boolean functionIs(int function)
      Checks whether the function equals the provided integer
      boolean functionIs(String function)
      Checks whether the function in this message equals the provided String.
      int[] getAppendArguments()
      This returns the array of arguments that should be considered when appending this message is appended to another message.
      int getArgument(int argPos)
      Returns the arguments at the specified position.
      int[] getArguments()
      Returns an array list of all arguments.
      int getDeliveryTime()
      Calculates how long the message took to be delivered
      int getFunction()
      Returns the current function called by the message
      Lithne getLithne()
      Returns the Lithne object that sends this message.
      int getNumberOfArguments()
      Returns the number of arguments currently in this message.
      int[] getOverwriteArguments()
      This returns the array of arguments that should be considered when overwriting this message is appended to another message.
      int[] getPayload()
      Returns the payload to be transmitted via the Zigbee message, standard including the scope.

      Returns the payload for a ZigBee message, based on the specified information in this message.

      Returns the current size of the payload

      Returns the current retry count

      Returns the current scope of this message.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        This function checks whether the message has a valid 64-bit XBeeAddress or valid 16-bit XBeeAddress. Returns 'true' if the message can be send. Returns 'false' if the message can't be send.

      • overwriteIfEqual

        public void overwriteIfEqual(int argNumber)
        Use this function to indicate specific arguments that should be checked before this message can be overwritten. By specifying an argument number you indicate that the message arguments may be overwritten if that specific argument is similar
        Parameters:

      • setFunction

        public void setFunction(String function)
        Change the function specified in the message using a String. The String is first hashed to a number, before being set. Please note that you can use maximum of ~250 characters.
